first.name: Harold
first.text: First, observe the giant hole in the ground the camera just focused on. That's the Rabbit Hole. |It leads directly to where the rabbits are nesting.

explanation_harold_2.name: Harold
explanation_harold_2.content: As the surveyor, my job is to monitor the state of the rabbits, and let you know when they're about to come out of their hole.

explanation_harold_3.name: Harold
explanation_harold_3.text: I can also point out potential hazard areas in the environment, such as this steep precipice.|@@If a rabbit falls too far and hits the ground...well, let's just say that would be bad for the rabbit.

explanation_harriet_2.name: Harriet
explanation_harriet_2.text: Let's take a look at the [b][color=#3399ff]Ethical Containment Chamber[/color][/b], or [b][color=#3399ff]ECC[/color][/b]. This is where we capture the rabbits and secure them for transport to one of our mass care centers. My job is to oversee the containment and transport processes, and ensure none of these valuable commodities comes to harm.

explanation_harriet_3.name: Harriet
explanation_harriet_3.content: As the Rabbit Trail Manager, your job is to get those rabbits safely from their Rabbit Hole to the ECC.

explanation_controls_harold_1.name: Harold
explanation_controls_harold_1.content: On that note, let's give you a brief overview of the control console, at the bottom of your screen.

explanation_controls_harold_2.name: Harold
explanation_controls_harold_2.content: The visa-textual screen is where other R-Tech employees or authorized third-party agents can communicate with you. If you can see me, you know where this is.

explanation_controls_harold_3.name: Harold
explanation_controls_harold_3.text: Next, the Statistic displays. The first one is the Rabbit Tracker, aptly indicated by the rabbit head icon.

explanation_controls_harold_4.name: Harold
explanation_controls_harold_4.content: You may have noticed our bionic test rabbit running around on the bottom of the screen.| Now, note the yellow '1' in the Rabbit Tracker. The yellow numbers indicate how many rabbits are out and running about.

explanation_controls_harold_4a.name: Harold
explanation_controls_harold_4a.content: The green numbers indicate how many rabbits have been captured, and the red numbers indicate how many rabbits are damaged beyond scientific usefulness.

harriet_interjection_1.name: Harriet
harriet_interjection_1.content: It's okay to say they're dead, you know.

explanation_controls_harold_5.name: Harold
explanation_controls_harold_5.content: Just using the suggested terminology from the latest revision of the company policy handbook.|@@The next Stat Display is the Budget Tracker. This shows you how much of the mission's allotted funds you have left to spend. We'll get into more detail on the budget shortly.

explanation_controls_harold_6.name: Harold
explanation_controls_harold_6.content: The last Stat Display is the Time Tracker. This keeps track of how much time you've spent on the current mission. This factors into your Employee Efficiency Index calculation during post-mission review.

explanation_eei_harold_1.name: Harold
explanation_eei_harold_1.content: EEI is how R-Tech evaluates you as an employee. Several factors go into the calculation, but the gist is this: if you capture enough rabbits, in a modestly efficient manner, you'll pass. The more rabbits you capture, and the more efficiently you do so, the better your EEI rating will be.

explanation_controls_harriet_1.name: Harriet
explanation_controls_harriet_1.content: Ai yai yai, yadda yadda yadda. Let's move on to the fun stuff: the Command Card.

harold_interjection_1.name: Harold
harold_interjection_1.content: Hey, I was about to do that

explanation_controls_harriet_2.name: Harriet
explanation_controls_harriet_2.content: The Command Card, on the right side of the console, is where you requisition Gizmos

explanation_controls_harriet_3.name: Harriet
explanation_controls_harriet_3.content: and issue commands to Gizmos that have already been placed on the mission field.

explanation_controls_harriet_buttom_1.name: Harriet
explanation_controls_harriet_buttom_1.text: The first gizmo is the Platform. As its name suggests, rabbits can jump on top of it to cross chasms.

explanation_controls_harriet_buttom_2.name: Harriet
explanation_controls_harriet_buttom_2.text: The second gizmo is the Jump Pad. Rabbits can hop on this and get a large vertical boost upwards.| While the Platform can be placed anywhere in the air, the Jump Pad can only be placed on the ground.

explanation_controls_harriet_buttom_3.name: Harriet
explanation_controls_harriet_buttom_3.text: The third gizmo is the Thrust. This gizmo shunts a rabbit in the direction indicated by the red arrow. You can change the rotation to send a rabbit in whatever direction is needed to accomplish your goal.

explanation_controls_harriet_buttom_4.name: Harriet
explanation_controls_harriet_buttom_4.text: The fourth gizmo is the Slowdown. When you encounter those steep precipices Harold mentioned eariler, you can use these gizmos to slow a rabbit's fall. Gravity will take over again once they leave the gizmo's area of effect, so choose your placements wisely.

explanation_controls_harriet_buttom_5.name: Harriet
explanation_controls_harriet_buttom_5.text: Finally, we have the Scarecrow. When a rabbit sees a Scarecrow, they'll immediately turn around and move the opposite direction. This is useful in cases where a rabbit is heading somewhere you don't want it to go.

explanation_controls_harold_budget_1.name: Harold
explanation_controls_harold_budget_1.content: Now, you can't place these, uh, 'gizmos' for free. Each has a budget cost, which you can review by hovering over each gizmo's respective build button. When you place a gizmo, that budget cost will be subtracted from the budget funds I mentioned earlier.

explanation_controls_harold_budget_2.name: Harold
explanation_controls_harold_budget_2.content: However, if you cancel a placement by hitting the cancel button, or by right-clicking, the gizmo will not be placed, and no budget funding will be spent.

explanation_controls_harold_movement_1.name: Harold
explanation_controls_harold_movement_1.content: To move a placed unit, simply click on it to select it, then use the Unit Command Card to select what action you want to take. 'Move' lets you reposition the gizmo, at no cost, 'Cancel' lets you cancel a movement in progress, and 'Delete' scraps the gizmo, refunding half of its cost.

explanation_controls_harold_movement_2.name: Harold
explanation_controls_harold_movement_2.content: Note that right-clicking while moving a gizmo will also cancel the movement, and return the gizmo to the place you originally placed it.

explanation_ending_harriet_1.name: Harriet
explanation_ending_harriet_1.content: Whew, that was a lot of info. To pass the intro exam, simply bring the test bunny safely to the ECC. Good luck!
